info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CLARK AND WEST CENTRAL MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Springfield to near London, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, London, Choctaw Lake, Harmony, Brighton, South Vienna, Buck Creek State Park, Interstate 70 at State Route 56 and Plattsburg. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 59 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
